places_to_visit.name: Miniatur Wunderland
places_to_visit.description: Miniatur Wunderland is the world's largest model railway exhibition. It features highly detailed miniature worlds representing different regions and countries.

places_to_visit.name: Elbphilharmonie
places_to_visit.description: Elbphilharmonie is a modern concert hall with a unique glass structure. It offers panoramic views of Hamburg from its Plaza and hosts world-class musical performances.

places_to_visit.name: Hamburg Harbor
places_to_visit.description: Hamburg Harbor is one of the largest ports in Europe. Visitors can take boat tours to see the bustling port activities and the historic Speicherstadt district.

places_to_visit.name: St. Michael’s Church
places_to_visit.description: St. Michael’s Church, also known as Michel, is a Baroque church with a prominent tower offering stunning views of Hamburg. It’s one of the city’s landmarks and a significant historical site.

places_to_visit.name: Speicherstadt
places_to_visit.description: Speicherstadt is the world’s largest warehouse district, known for its red brick buildings and canals. It offers a glimpse into Hamburg’s past as a major trading hub.
